adverb.description: With the head going first or in front of the rest of the body; head first. Also figurative: precipitately, hastily; headlong, recklessly.

adjective.description: Characterized by falling or diving head-foremost. Also figurative: precipitate, hasty; reckless. Now rare.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in William Dampier (1651–1715), buccaneer and explorer. From head + foremost.
